results.title: Palm Beach
results.creator_credit: Albie Thoms Productions and Albie Thoms
results.brief_description: A quasi-documentary fiction film about the suburban sub-culture of of Sydney’s northern beach areas. It is, simultaneously, a fast-paced thriller involving surf, drugs and rock n roll. Forty eight hours in the lives of a handful of young Australians. Paul was looking for work … Joe was looking on. Stars Nat Young and Bryan Brown. Rated: M

results.title: Palio
results.creator_credit: Michael Weigall Productions and Michael Weigall
results.brief_description: Shows “The Palio”, a wild horse race representing Siena’s seventeen districts. Held in a mediaeval square, it was inaugurated in the 18th century by Violanta of Medici as a safety valve for local factions continuing to this day, and is dubbed as the world’s only political horse race.

results.title: Palette of glass
results.brief_description: Shows the creation of a set of stained glass windows for the Art Institute of Chicago, tracing the project from design to installation. Illustrates the fascinating collaboration between the artist, Marc Chagall, and the glass-maker to produce such wonderful designs. Spoken in English and French (with English subtitles). Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Pale rider
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood stars in this classic tale of right, wrong and retribution which takes place in a corrupt and violent gold rush town. The local miners are trying to fend off a take-over attempt from a powerful mining syndicate. Corporate mining boss, Coy LaHood offers the miners a deal: get out or be carried out. The miners have little choice until a mysterious stranger rides into town. The miners call him the Preacher. La Hood hires a band of thugs to kill the Preacher and the miners, but even though he pays in gold he hasn’t reckoned on the Preacher, who pays off in lead! Dark, funny and quietly sophisticated, “Pale Rider” reinterprets the Western in a manner that shamelessly combines melodrama, myth and irony.

results.title: Palaeolithic man
results.brief_description: Illustrates the way of life of palaeolithic hunters and food gatherers, based on three sources of evidence that remain today - weapons and implements found near their primitive hearths, drawings from European cave settlements and the nomadic lives of Australian Aborigines.
results.description: Illustrates the way of life of palaeolithic hunters and food gatherers, based on three sources of evidence that remain today - weapons and implements found near their primitive hearths, drawings from European cave settlements and the nomadic lives of Australian Aborigines.

results.title: Palace Cafe
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Murray Fahey and Andrew Lancaster
results.brief_description: The Palace Cafe, a place where solitary drinkers sip their cappuccinos, read their newspapers and nothing much else happens. The cafe becomes alive one night when a lonely man spots an attractive woman across the room and staff and patrons burst into dance, choreographing their moves to the tune of the lonely man’s imagination.

results.title: Pal Joey
results.creator_credit: Essex, George Sidney Productions, Fred Kohlmar and George Sidney
results.brief_description: Pal Joey, starring Frank Sinatra, Kim Novak and Rita Hayworth, is strong, funny entertainment based on a novel by John O’Hara. It features 14 songs from Rodgers and Hart including “The Lady is a Tramp”, “Bewitched, Bothered and Bewildered” and “My Funny Valentine”. Sinatra is an out of heel nightclub singer, Joey Evans, who plays the field with women. He is ideal as the irreverent, glib Joey.

results.title: Pakistan: a two-part nation
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and Suzanne Talbot Isaacs
results.brief_description: A study of East and West Pakistan, this film views the problems which arise from differences in people, geography and economy, between the two. Amidst uncertainty that threatens progress, the two Pakistans are held together by their religious tie of Islam.
